title: Mental Toughness (MT) Training in Sports: Emotional Learning-Based Simulation Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners assume professional roles (medical/legal/technical) and apply sports psychology principles through scientific approaches

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain three core elements (contextual intelligence, attentional regulation, emotional regulation) for evaluating mental toughness (MT) in various competitive situations
Learners can apply ACT (Acceptance and Commitment Therapy)-based strategies in simulated pressure scenarios to improve problem-solving skills by over 80%
Learners improve decision-making accuracy by 35% compared to baseline under stress conditions similar to real competitions through VR training modules
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
